item.title: Samsung announces major security enhancements coming to One UI 8
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Samsung has announced multiple data security and privacy enhancements for its upcoming Galaxy smartphones running One UI 8, its custom user interface on top of Android. [...]

item.title: M&S confirms social engineering led to massive ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: M&S confirmed today that the retail outlet's network was initially breached in a "sophisticated impersonation attack" that ultimately led to a DragonForce ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: New Android TapTrap attack fools users with invisible UI trick
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A novel tapjacking technique can exploit user interface animations to bypass Android's permission system and allow access to sensitive data or trick users into performing destructive actions, such as wiping the device. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5062554 cumulative update released with 13 changes, fixes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the KB5062554 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2, with thirteen new fixes or changes. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5062553 & KB5062552 cumulative updates released
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5062553 and KB5062552 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities and issues. [...]

item.title: Microsoft July 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes one zero-day, 137 flaws
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Today is Microsoft's July 2025 Patch Tuesday, which includes security updates for 137 flaws, including one publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft SQL Server. [...]

item.title: Android malware Anatsa infiltrates Google Play to target US banks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Anatsa banking trojan has sneaked into Google Play once more via an app posing as a PDF viewer that counted more than 50,000 downloads. [...]

item.title: Overcoming Technical Barriers in Desktop and Application Virtualization
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by TruGrid
item.description: Exposed RDP ports are an open door for attackers. TruGrid SecureRDP enforces Zero Trust and MFA, blocks lateral movement, and secures remote access—no open firewall ports required. Learn more and get a free trial. [...]

item.title: Malicious Chrome extensions with 1.7M installs found on Web Store
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Almost a dozen malicious extensions with 1.7 million downloads in Google's Chrome Web Store could track users, steal browser activity, and redirect to potentially unsafe web addresses. [...]

item.title: Alleged Chinese hacker tied to Silk Typhoon arrested for cyberespionage
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A Chinese national was arrested in Milan, Italy, last week for allegedly being linked to the state-sponsored Silk Typhoon hacking group, which responsible for cyberattacks against American organizations and government agencies. [...]

item.title: Public exploits released for Citrix Bleed 2 NetScaler flaw, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Researchers have released proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits for a critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5777 and dubbed CitrixBleed2, warning that the flaw is easily exploitable and can successfully steal user session tokens. [...]

item.title: Employee gets $920 for credentials used in $140 million bank heist
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers stole nearly $140 million from six banks in Brazil by using an employee's credentials from C&M, a company that offers financial connectivity solutions. [...]

item.title: Atomic macOS infostealer adds backdoor for persistent attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Malware analyst discovered a new version of the Atomic macOS info-stealer (also known as 'AMOS') that comes with a backdoor, to attackers persistent access to compromised systems. [...]
